hero.head: The Architecture of Self-Rule
hero.text: True sovereignty is not a feeling. It is a structure. IRON provides the Constitutional Spine—Court, Legislature, and Executive—to govern your personal empire with institutional grade authority.

philosophy.title: What is IRON?
philosophy.intro: IRON is not an app. It is a <1>Behavourial Governing System</1>.
philosophy.p1: Traditional apps are advisory. They provide lists, charts, and notifications. They depend on your mood to function.
philosophy.p2: IRON is <1>mandatory</1>. It utilizes an internal Institutional State to govern your access to information and features based on your actual performance. It turns your commitments into "Laws" that are monitored by the Institutional Kernel.
philosophy.principle_1: <1>Standing:</1> Your reputation within your own system.
philosophy.principle_3: <1>Consequences:</1> Real-time degradation of the experience when law is breached.

constitution.title: The IRON Constitution
constitution.intro_1: IRON is not a habit tracker. IRON is a behavioural institution.
constitution.intro_2: Its purpose is to establish, govern, and preserve personal discipline through enforceable commitments, permanent records, and escalating accountability.

1.title: Article I — Sovereignty of the Ledger
1.content: The Behavioural Ledger is the single source of truth. All user state must be derivable exclusively from ledger history. The ledger records only facts: events that have occurred under system authority.

2.title: Article II — Standing as Supreme Authority
2.content: Every user exists in exactly one Standing at any time. Standing governs what actions are permitted, what screens are accessible, and what tone the system adopts. If Standing cannot justify an experience, that experience must not exist.

3.title: Article III — Contractual Entry
3.content: Entry into IRON occurs only through Induction. A contract defines minimum obligations, evaluation rules, and failure conditions. Without a contract, no user is considered a member.

4.title: Article IV — Daily Governance
4.content: IRON is organised around institutional days. Each day may create obligations. Every governed day must be closed by ledger entry. An open day is an unresolved institutional state.

5.title: Article V — Irreversibility
5.content: All institutional outcomes leave permanent record. Failures must produce historical facts. No mechanism may erase institutional history. Progress accumulates. Failure scars.

6.title: Article VI — Escalation of Commitment
6.content: Continued compliance must increase institutional weight. Stability must never reduce consequence. Time strengthens authority.

7.title: Article VII — Breach and Recovery
7.content: Breach is a formal institutional event. Recovery is not a reset; it is a governed process with defined cost. The system must always remember the difference between continuity and repair.

8.title: Article VIII — Experience Subordination
8.content: The interface exists to expose system reality. UI may not soften outcomes, conceal standing, or simulate progress. The interface is a window, not a playground.

9.title: Article IX — Institutional Voice
9.content: IRON communicates as a system, not a motivator. Language must be precise, non-sentimental, and consequence-oriented. Praise is replaced by confirmation.

10.title: Article X — Product Law
10.content: Retention is not a feature. It is the result of governance. Any component that does not strengthen behavioural authority violates this Constitution.

preamble.line3: It exists to restore sovereignty of action to the individual in an era of behavioral erosion, algorithmic dependency, and motivational decay.
preamble.line4: Where modern systems optimize comfort, IRON enforces coherence.
preamble.line5: Where platforms extract attention, IRON demands standing.
preamble.line6: Where tools assist behavior, IRON governs it.
preamble.line7: IRON was founded on the premise that will without structure collapses, and that freedom without law decays into drift.
preamble.line8: This charter establishes IRON as a sovereign self-governance system: a formal authority under which an individual may bind themselves to discipline, consequence, and irreversible personal law.

1.title: ARTICLE I — NATURE OF THE INSTITUTION
1.content: IRON is a constitutional behavioral institution. It does not motivate. It does not coach. It does not persuade. It registers commitments, records actions, delivers verdicts, and assigns standing.
1.footer: Within IRON, behavior is not tracked. Behavior is adjudicated.

2.title: ARTICLE II — JURISDICTION
2.content: IRON’s jurisdiction applies to any individual who voluntarily enters its authority. Upon entry, the individual ceases to act merely as a user and is instead recognized as a subject of the institution.
2.footer: IRON does not erase. IRON does not forget. IRON does not negotiate with history. IRON maintains a continuous, append-only record of conduct under its authority.

3.title: ARTICLE III — SOVEREIGN PRINCIPLES
3.content: IRON is governed by the following non-negotiable principles:
principles: **Supremacy of Law**: All behavior within IRON is subordinate to its constitutional codes.
**Event Sovereignty**: State changes only through recorded events. Nothing becomes true unless it is written.
**Irreversibility**: What is entered into the ledger cannot be undone.
**Standing**: An individual’s position within IRON is not claimed. It is accumulated, degraded, restored, or lost.
**Consequence**: Every sustained action pattern produces institutional outcome.
**Separation of Powers**: The engine governs. The ledger remembers. The interface only projects.

4.title: ARTICLE IV — ENTRY
4.content: Entry into IRON is not sign-up. It is initiation.
to_enter: Declare an initial domain of sovereignty
Accept institutional authority over that domain
4.footer: From this moment forward, conduct within that scope is no longer private intent. It is institutional history.

5.title: ARTICLE V — THE LEDGER
5.content: The IRON Ledger is the institutional memory. It records declarations, commitments, actions, failures, verdicts, standing transitions, collapses, and recoveries.
5.footer: The ledger does not interpret. The ledger witnesses.

6.title: ARTICLE VI — VERDICTS AND STANDING
6.content: IRON does not reward. IRON issues verdicts based on recorded events, constitutional law, and institutional codes.
6.footer: Standing is never cosmetic. Standing alters what the institution will recognize, permit, or register.

7.title: ARTICLE VII — COLLAPSE AND RECOVERY
7.content: When sustained contradiction between commitment and conduct is detected, IRON may declare collapse. Collapse is institutional acknowledgment of structural failure.
7.footer: This ensures that sovereignty is not performative. It is earned.

8.title: ARTICLE VIII — CHARTERED INSTITUTIONS
8.content: IRON itself is the core institution. Within it may exist chartered institutions governing specific domains (Physical, Cognitive, Recovery, etc.).
8.footer: Each chartered institution operates under IRON’s supremacy, maintains its own codes, and issues its own verdicts — but all share the same sovereign ledger.

9.title: ARTICLE IX — LIMITATIONS
9.content: IRON does not claim ownership of the individual, dictate values, or replace medicine, law, or therapy. IRON governs only what is formally placed under its jurisdiction. Everything else remains outside its authority.

10.title: ARTICLE X — DECLARATION
10.content: IRON exists to restore what modern systems dissolved: Continuity, Consequence, Structure, Identity under law.
purpose: Those who enter IRON do so not to be assisted — but to be held.
Not to be motivated — but to be bound.
Not to feel empowered — but to become institutionally accountable.

closing.line1: IRON is a system for those who no longer seek tools, but law.
closing.line4: It is not built to grow fast. It is built to stand.
